Name: team_assigned_to_exactly_one_project
Description: Each team must be assigned to exactly one project (R1)

Name: worker_belongs_to_exactly_one_team
Description: Each worker belongs to exactly one team (R2)

Name: scrummaster_supports_one_team
Description: Each team is supported by exactly one Scrum Master (R6)

Name: product_owner_manages_one_backlog
Description: Each Product Backlog is managed by exactly one Product Owner (R5)

Name: feature_in_at_most_one_backlog
Description: Any feature appears in at most one Product Backlog (R7)

Name: epic_in_at_most_one_backlog
Description: Any epic appears in at most one Product Backlog (R8)

Name: user_story_in_exactly_one_epic
Description: Each user story belongs to exactly one epic (R9)

Name: task_in_exactly_one_user_story
Description: Each task belongs to exactly one user story (R10)

Name: user_story_in_at_most_one_sprint_backlog
Description: Each user story is assigned to at most one sprint backlog (R11)

Name: sprint_backlog_belongs_to_one_sprint
Description: Each sprint backlog belongs to exactly one sprint (R12)

Name: sprint_backlog_capacity_respected
Description: Total planned effort in a sprint backlog does not exceed its effort capacity

Name: release_only_features_in_backlog
Description: Release plans include only features that are present in some product backlog (R20
